channel.title: RSS Aggregator Feed
channel.description: An aggregated feed of Technology-related news

item.title: Ritz Cracker Sandwiches Recalled in 8 States for Undeclared Peanut Butter
item.description: Bad news for people with peanut allergies.

item.title: Cloudflare Has Blocked 416 Billion AI Bot Requests Since July 1
item.description: Cloudflare CEO Matthew Prince claims the internet infrastructure company’s efforts to block AI crawlers are already seeing big results.

item.title: Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War 4 gets a new story trailer teasing the playable Dark Angels faction ahead of its 2026 launch
item.description: Deep Silver and King Art Games have shared a new story trailer for Warhammer 40,000: Dawn of War 4, teasing an epic campaign and the playable Dark Angels faction.

item.title: Over 70 US banks and credit unions affected by Marquis ransomware breach - here's what we know
item.description: Marquis was struck with ransomware and allegedly even paid the demand.

item.title: Looking to supercharge your Raspberry Pi? This adapter provides two full-sized HDMI ports and a PCIe connector - and it only costs $10
item.description: The $10 Waveshare adapter expands Raspberry Pi 5 connectivity through dual HDMI support and a functional PCIe M.2 slot.

item.title: Pentagon’s Signalgate report finds Pete Hegseth violated military policies
item.description: It has been months since a group of Trump administration officials put together a Signal group chat to discuss classified military intelligence ahead of a military strike in Yemen while inadvertently adding a journalist, and now the Pentagon’s inspector general has released its report on the mess. The results of Steven Stebbins’ eight-month-long investigation found […]...

item.title: Anthropic’s Daniela Amodei Believes the Market Will Reward Safe AI
item.description: The Trump administration might think regulation is killing the AI industry, but Anthropic president Daniela Amodei disagrees.

item.title: Shingles Vaccine Doesn’t Just Lower Dementia Risk, It Could Also Help Treat It
item.description: New research finds the shingles vaccine can potentially provide broad protection against dementia.

item.title: ‘Andor’ Can’t Be the End of Good ‘Star Wars’
item.description: This year marked the end of a new era of 'Star Wars' and hopefully gave the franchise its blueprint for the future.

item.title: Looks Like We Can Finally Kiss the Metaverse Goodbye
item.description: It appears Meta's Horizon Worlds may literally and figuratively not have legs after all.

item.title: This tiny white tower packs an RTX 5060 GPU and a Ryzen 9 8945HX CPU, but looks nothing like a mini PC
item.description: Minisforum AtomMan G1 Pro mini PC pairs a mobile-class flagship CPU with a desktop GPU inside a narrow chassis, pushing cooling limits hard.

item.title: Bending Spoons continues its spree of buying famous tech brands with the Eventbrite deal
item.description: Bending Spoons buys Eventbrite for $500 million, aiming to revive growth using operational changes, pricing strategies, and product enhancements.

item.title: Game in style with almost 50% off this 31.5-inch MSI Curved Gaming Monitor
item.description: This MSI is a cheap full HD curved gaming monitor with a high refresh rate and low response time.

item.title: They’re Trying to Make a ‘Men in Black’ Movie Again
item.description: Will Smith could potentially return in a new film penned by the writer of 'Bad Boys for Life.'

item.title: What Happens When Your Coworkers Are AI Agents
item.description: In this episode of Uncanny Valley, we talk to writer Evan Ratliff about how he created a small startup made entirely of AI employees—and what his findings reveal about the reality of an agentic future.

item.title: The Hunt for Missing Malaysia Flight 370 Is Back On. Here’s Why It Might Actually Work
item.description: Ocean Infinity, a Texas-based marine robotics company, will deploy a more advanced fleet of search vessels in pursuit of the missing plane.

item.title: The AI race explodes as HPE deploys AMD’s Helios racks, crushing limits with Venice CPUs and insane GPU density
item.description: HPE adopts AMD Helios AI racks with 72 GPUs and Venice CPUs, aiming for exascale workloads while testing Ethernet scale-up.

item.title: Meta stock price: META rises on report that Zuckerberg will cut up to 30% of metaverse division
item.description: Cuts—and potential layoffs—could come as early as January 2026, and will see the company’s virtual reality (VR) group significantly downsized. Shares of Meta Platforms, Inc. (META) rose on Thursday after Bloomberg reported the technology company was planning to cut spending across its division by 10%, with as much as 30% cuts to its virtual reality group, which includes the so-called metaverse....

item.title: The Final ‘A Knight of the Seven Kingdoms’ Trailer Teases the Misfit Heroes We Can’t Wait to Meet
item.description: HBO's next George R.R. Martin adaptation—which has already been renewed for a second season—takes us back to Westeros starting January 18.

item.title: Le gouvernement reporte l’obligation d’installer un thermostat connecté à 2030
item.description: Trois ans de sursis, c'est ce que viennent de gagner les propriétaires qui n'auront pas à installer de thermostat connecté dans leurs logements et bâtiments d'ici 2027. La date limite a été reportée à 2030 par le gouvernement.

item.title: Musk, Bezos, and Zuckerberg Are Full of Shit (Literally) in New Art Exhibit
item.description: Would hate to have to clean up that mess.

item.title: Scientists engineer erbium molecular qubits that plug directly into existing fiber networks, promising telecom-ready quantum systems
item.description: Erbium molecular qubits create a spin-photon interface compatible with telecom networks, enabling hybrid quantum devices and potential scalable quantum communication.

item.title: Trump invites ‘cute’ Japanese kei trucks to come to America
item.description: Tiny kei trucks from Japan have a new fan: President Donald Trump. Trump expressed admiration for the pint-sized autos during a briefing with reporters to announce his plan to gut fuel economy standards. “They’re very small. They’re really cute,” Trump said. “And I said, how would that do in this country? And everyone seems to think, good, […]

item.title: Anthropic CEO weighs in on AI bubble talk and risk-taking among competitors
item.description: Anthropic's CEO shared his thoughts on the economics of AI and the risk-taking of competitors, saying some were "YOLO-ing" with regard to spending.
